data.title: Last movie you saw thread
data.meta_description: Gone Baby Gone - 8.5/10  - Pretty intense brilliant stuff and a very taut and suspenseful thriller. Cast is great with Ryan the MVP. Surprisingly emotional towards the last half.
data.text:
Post by Drish on

Gone Baby Gone - 8.5/10

- Pretty intense brilliant stuff and a very taut and suspenseful thriller. Cast is great with Ryan the MVP. Surprisingly emotional towards the last half.

Post by harlequinade on

Gone Baby Gone - 8.5/10

- Pretty intense brilliant stuff and a very taut and suspenseful thriller. Cast is great with Ryan the MVP. Surprisingly emotional towards the last half.

I didn't like the story in that one but Affleck's directing was amazing. Also Ed Harris <3

Post by bobbystarks on

First off, LOL at your avatar.

Anyway, I watched Jarmusch's Broken Flowers (8/10) last night and I really dug it. Very quiet film and I loved how it used the different women he met as metaphors for the different relationships you experience throughout life. And Tilda Swinton was in the film for maybe two minutes and absolutely stole the show. How the hell does she do that??

Post by pessimusreincarnated on

Paterson (2016)- 8.5/10

Lovely little film. Could've easily come off as slight and pretentious, but thanks to Jarmusch's talent for creating stories that are small in scale yet rich in themes, it's a joy to watch. Adam Driver turns in his best performance yet as the soft-spoken, perceptive title character, really anchoring the entire film as a whole.

Post by theycallmemrfish on

Arrival - ****.

Bought it early on Amazon and it really didn't disappoint. Loved everything about it.

This was also good because my previous first-viewing was Dirty Grandpa, which was the equivalent of taint sweat.

Post by mhynson27 on

I re-watched The Nice Guys the other night. Just as good and funny as I remember it. My #5 of 2016, I nominate Gosling, Rice and the Screenplay.

Post by harlequinade on

Just watched Pollock which was good, the acting however was great. I know a lot of people say this is Harris' best work but I saw Sweet Dreams last week and he was just incredible there. He was amazing here as was Marcia, very cool she got an Oscar for this.

Post by Zeb31 on

You Can Count on Me. Wasn't a huge fan of Ruffalo's performance, but Linney is luminous and their last scene together is devastating. Very touching little film, even if it lacks the ambition and emotional punch of Lonergan's following two. 8/10.

Post by napierslogs on

Frank and Cindy. I've become a pretty big Johnny Simmons fan, although I normally wouldn't go for a movie like that. But I ended up liking it. Cute and funny at times, and the fact that it was a personal story definitely helped make it feel very honest emotionally. Solid acting.

7/10

Post by Pittsnogle_Goggins on

Edge of Seventeen. Really liked this and was quite impressed with Steinfeld.

Also, I can't get anything to work for my avatar. Someone pleae help me!!!

Post by Zeb31 on

Also, I can't get anything to work for my avatar. Someone pleae help me!!!

Go to "Profile" at the top of this page. Then "Edit profile", upload or link to a picture, select "Use only the Uploaded/Linked", and then save avatar changes. That should work.

Post by elevenx23 on

Paterson (2016)- 8.5/10

Lovely little film. Could've easily come off as slight and pretentious, but thanks to Jarmusch's talent for creating stories that are small in scale yet rich in themes, it's a joy to watch. Adam Driver turns in his best performance yet as the soft-spoken, perceptive title character, really anchoring the entire film as a whole.

Amazon so screwed up this movie's release that I'm rooting for their precious Manchester to win zero Oscars just because they didn't care for anything else on their slate.

Last movie I saw - ROTK last night. It was as magnificent as 14 years ago. Last truly deserving Best Picture win, IMO, out of winners that I've seen (haven't seen NCFOM but hearing it's a masterpiece).

Post by bobbystarks on

Edge of Seventeen. Really liked this and was quite impressed with Steinfeld.

Also, I can't get anything to work for my avatar. Someone pleae help me!!!

You have to upload your picture. Then click the little checkbox on the left that says "Use only the Uploaded/Linked"

And Steinfeld's just fucking fantastic, isn't she? The more I think about it the more it's becoming my favorite performance of the year.

Post by elevenx23 on

Steinfeld is fantastic, agreed. The older she gets the better her career will be. It's tough for teens to get great roles except once in a blue moon. Edge of 17 is once in a blue moon. Much like Saoirse Ronan. She was struggling too after her first Oscar nom.

Post by bobbystarks on

Steinfeld is fantastic, agreed. The older she gets the better her career will be. It's tough for teens to get great roles except once in a blue moon. Edge of 17 is once in a blue moon. Much like Saoirse Ronan. She was struggling too after her first Oscar nom.

I've been saying this exact same thing! Are you in my brain? Get out!

Also, I can't get anything to work for my avatar. Someone pleae help me!!!

It wont accept any link I put in though.

Post by mikediastavrone96 on

bobbystarks I still have plenty to see, but right now Steinfeld is still my favorite performance of 2016, just slightly edging out Casey Affleck in my last seen film Manchester by the Sea, which I gave an 8/10. Well, that was a very forced way to tie in the reply and the topic of the thread in one sentence.

bobbystarks I still have plenty to see, but right now Steinfeld is still my favorite performance of 2016, just slightly edging out Casey Affleck in my last seen film Manchester by the Sea, which I gave an 8/10. Well, that was a very forced way to tie in the reply and the topic of the thread in one sentence.

Yeah Casey's definitely my favorite male performance of the year. Steinfeld and Oulaya Amamra

in Divines are battling it out for the overall female performance for me. And then Bryce Dallas Howard in Black Mirror is my favorite of the year in any medium, but I'm strictly talking film.
